title: NASA Blazes a Path Back to the Moon With Artemis I Rocket Launch
description: The uncrewed flight of the giant Space Launch System on Wednesday began a new era of spaceflight amid a debate over how to finance rocket development.

title: What Employees Does Twitter Need, Anyway?
description: The many departures have set off a wave of hand-wringing about whether the site can continue to operate well.

title: Elizabeth Holmes Is Sentenced to More Than 11 Years for Theranos Fraud
description: Ms. Holmes was convicted in January of four counts of wire fraud for deceiving investors with claims about her blood testing start-up Theranos.

title: Elon Musk’s Twitter Teeters on the Edge After Another 1,200 Leave
description: Mr. Musk sent emails on Friday asking to learn about Twitter’s underlying technology as key infrastructure teams have been decimated.

title: Ticketmaster’s Parent Company Said to Face Justice Department Investigation
description: The inquiry predates the botched presale of Taylor Swift tickets this week and is said to focus on whether Live Nation has abused its power in the live music industry.

title: How to Download Your Twitter Archive
description: Those worried about the service’s longevity can preserve their tweets, media and direct messages.

title: FTX’s Unraveling and Elon Musk’s Ultimatum to Twitter Employees
description: Sam Bankman-Fried’s DMs go public, and Congress announces an investigation. Tech’s nightmare November continues.
